course_title: Reducing Drug-Related Harms Using Big Data: Administrative, geospatial, and network sources.
class_notes:
This course is open to graduate student from any department. Familiarity and comfort with the following is needed to successfully complete the course:
 Regression (e.g. BIOS 501, BSHES 700)
 SAS (e.g.BIOS 501)
 R (e.g. BIOS 544)
For more information on the TADA program and course prerequisites, please visit the TADA course information page (https://scholarblogs.emory.edu/rollinssudprogram/tada-courses/
course_description: Learning to analyze administrative, network & geospatial data in the context of research & interventions for substance use disorders & drug-related harms.
schedule_location: W 3pm-5:30pm in R. Randall Rollins Bldg. R340
sections: Class Nbr: 5214, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 3-5:30p, Instructor: Team, Status: Open
